item.title: 外国投资者将结束对亚洲新兴市场股票的连续购买
item.description: 全球资金正从亚洲新兴市场撤出，连续五个月的股票购买热潮因美国降息预期减弱而告终。【原文：Global funds are retreating from emerging markets in Asia, with a five-month buying spree of stocks ending on scaled-down expectations for US rate cuts.】

item.title: 日本激进基金将在股东大会上要求大同公司首席执行官下台
item.description: 丸喜刚（Tsuyoshi Maruki）领导的激进基金战略资本公司（Strategic Capital Inc.【原文：Strategic Capital Inc., an activist fund led by Tsuyoshi Maruki, will push for the ouster of Daidoh Ltd.’s president after years of operating losses at the clothing manufacturer.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国市场现在的动向
item.description: 一位顾客在伦敦白教堂市场为农产品付款。摄影师：克里斯-拉特克利夫/布鲁姆伯格【原文：A customer pays for produce on Whitechapel market in London. Photographer: Chris Ratcliffe/Bloomberg】

item.title: 阿联酋航空因天气原因在迪拜暂停办理登机手续至午夜
item.description: 由于迪拜的恶劣天气扰乱了世界上最繁忙的航空枢纽之一的旅行，阿联酋航空当天停止了所有乘客的登机手续办理。【原文：Emirates is halting all check-ins for passengers for the day as bad weather in Dubai disrupts travel in one of the busiest aviation hubs in the world.】

item.title: 泰国与新西兰恢复直航，提升两国关系
item.description: 泰国和新西兰两国领导人誓言在未来二十年内将双边贸易额增加两倍，在大流行病导致空中交通中断之后，两国已同意恢复直飞航班。【原文：Thailand and New Zealand have agreed to resume direct flights after the pandemic shut air connectivity as leaders of the two countries vowed to triple bilateral trade in the next two decades.】

item.description:

Powell makes clear that the Fed won’t cut soon. The dollar is turning the screws, and markets and other central banks can’t keep up.

item.title: 冲突风险下亚洲天然气价格飙升接近今年最高水平
item.description: 亚洲液化天然气价格跃升至 1 月初以来的最高水平，因为人们担心以色列对伊朗上周末袭击的回应可能会演变成更大规模的冲突。【原文：Asian liquefied natural gas prices jumped to the highest level since early January amid anxiety that Israel’s response to Iran’s attack over the weekend may spiral into a wider conflict.】

item.title: 数据显示，瑞典住宅建设可能处于复苏边缘
item.description: 北欧最大国家瑞典的住房开工率显示，瑞典三十多年来最严重的住房建设低迷暂时结束了。【原文：Sweden’s worst slump in home construction in more than three decades is over for now, a gauge of housing starts in the largest Nordic nation suggests.】

item.title: 被扣押船舶的货物揭示伊朗紧张局势对全球贸易的影响
item.description: MSC Aries 号与其他 7000 艘在公海上航行的集装箱船并无太大区别，直到它在霍尔木兹海峡附近意外绕道，落入伊朗伊斯兰革命卫队之手。【原文：The MSC Aries wasn’t much different from the other 7,000 container ships plying the high seas, until it took an involuntary detour near the Strait of Hormuz into the hands of Iran’s Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps.】

item.title: 人民币限制利率空间，中国也不敢与美联储对抗
item.description: 在贸易战年代，中国想方设法规避美国对其经济施加的各种限制，从最新手机芯片禁令到伊朗石油制裁。但即使是北京，也无法轻易摆脱美联储的引力。【原文：In the trade-war years China has found ways to sidestep all kinds of US-imposed constraints on its economy — from curbs on the latest mobile-phone chips to Iran oil sanctions. But even Beijing can’t easily escape the gravitational pull of the Federal Reserve.】

item.title: 新西兰统计局就 CPI 数据错误道歉
item.description: 新西兰统计局表示，周三早些时候发布第一季度通胀数据时出现了错误。【原文：New Zealand’s statistics agency said it made an error earlier Wednesday when disseminating first-quarter inflation data.】

item.title: 香港人民币融资成本攀升，令看跌押注承压
item.description: 人民币最大的离岸交易中心开始出现现金紧缩的迹象，此举削弱了看跌中国管理货币的赌注的吸引力。【原文：Signs of a cash squeeze are starting to emerge in the yuan’s largest offshore trading center, a move that dents the appeal of bearish wagers on China’s managed currency.】

item.title: 菲律宾央行称比索下跌不会影响降息进程
item.description: 菲律宾中央银行行长伊莱-雷莫洛纳（Eli Remolona）表示，菲律宾比索跌至17个月低点的幅度还不足以破坏今年晚些时候或明年年初的货币宽松政策。【原文：The Philippine peso’s slide to a 17-month low isn’t large enough to derail monetary easing later this year or early next year, according to central bank Governor Eli Remolona.】

item.title: 中国开始对金融监管机构和最大银行进行检查
item.description: 中国启动了对一些最大的国有贷款机构、中央银行和主要监管机构的新一轮反渎职调查，这是自 2021 年一轮反渎职调查以来的首次广泛调查，这次调查在业界引起了震动。【原文：China kicked off new anti-graft inspections of some of its largest state lenders, the central bank and key regulators, the first broad probe since a round in 2021 that sent shock-waves through the industry.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利计划进行多年来最大一轮中国裁员
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士称，摩根士丹利计划本周开始在亚太地区裁减约 50 个投资银行职位，其中至少 80% 在香港和中国大陆。【原文：Morgan Stanley plans to start cutting about 50 investment-banking jobs in the Asia-Pacific region this week, with at least 80% of the reductions in Hong Kong and China, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 中国证监会寻求缓解退市担忧，中国小盘股上涨
item.description: 由于中国最高证券监管机构试图缓解人们对财务健康状况不佳的公司可能被除名的担忧，中国小盘股上涨，收窄了本周早些时候的跌幅。【原文：Chinese small-cap stocks rose, paring losses from their selloff earlier this week, as the nation’s top securities regulator sought to ease concern over the potential delisting of firms with weak financial health.】

item.title: 越南开始拯救西贡商业银行：路透社
item.description: 路透社援引三份银行文件和一位能接触到这些文件的身份不明人士的话报道称，越南已开始营救西贡股份商业银行。【原文：Vietnam has mounted a rescue of Saigon Joint Stock Commercial Bank, Reuters reported, citing three bank documents and an unidentified person with access to the documents.】

item.title: 中国住房问题恶化，铁矿石有望重回 100 美元价位
item.description: 据资本经济公司（Capital Economics Ltd.）称，随着中国房地产市场崩溃的加剧，铁矿石很可能在今年年底重新回到每吨 100 美元的价位，然后在 2025 年进一步跌至 85 美元。【原文：Iron ore is likely to revisit $100 a ton by the end of the year before falling further to $85 in 2025 as China’s housing market collapse worsens, according to Capital Economics Ltd.】

item.title: 菲律宾比索跌破 57 美元兑 1 美元的关键价位
item.description: 菲律宾比索自 2022 年底以来首次跌破每美元兑 57 美元的密切关注水平，原因是美联储将推迟降息的预期对风险资产构成了压力。【原文：The Philippine peso weakened past the closely watched 57-per-dollar level for the first time since late 2022, as expectations the Federal Reserve will delay interest-rate cuts weighed on risk assets.】

item.title: 担忧加剧，亚洲股市有望抹去2024年涨幅
item.description: 由于对利率长期化和地缘政治紧张局势的担忧引发了整个地区的股市下跌，亚洲股票基准有望抹去今年以来的所有涨幅。【原文：Asia’s stock benchmark was on track to erase all of its gains for the year, as worries about higher-for-longer interest rates and geopolitical tensions triggered losses across the region.】

item.title: 黄金接近历史最高水平，交易商对延迟减产持乐观态度
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔表示，美国央行维持利率不变的时间可能会比原计划更长，即便如此，黄金仍保持在纪录高位附近。【原文：Gold held near a record-high, even as as investors weighed a shift in messaging from Federal Reserve chief Jerome Powell, who said the US central bank will likely keep rates on hold for longer than originally planned.】

item.title: 保德信金融公司的 PGIM 努力出售新加坡大厦
item.description: 知情人士称，PGIM 房地产公司自去年以来一直试图出售新加坡的两座黄金办公楼，但未获成功，这是新加坡房地产市场疲软的最新迹象。【原文：PGIM Real Estate has been trying to sell a pair of prime office towers in Singapore since last year without success, people with knowledge of the matter said, the latest sign of the country’s softening property market.】

item.title: 韩国官员加强对韩元疲软的警告
item.description: 韩国官员加大了对韩元疲软的警告力度，韩国央行行长李昌镛称最近的举动有些过度，这是在周二韩元跌至关键水平后韩国当局的最新一次训斥。【原文：South Korean officials ramped up their warnings over weakness in the won with Bank of Korea Governor Rhee Chang-yong describing recent moves as a little excessive, in the latest jawboning by the authorities after the currency slid to a key level on Tuesday.】

item.title: 如何解读决策者对韩元急剧下跌的评论
item.description: 随着韩元迅速走软，首尔的决策者们加强了对韩元的评论，自 2022 年底以来首次短暂触及 1 美元兑 1400 韩元的关键水平。【原文：Policymakers in Seoul have stepped up their commentary on the won as the currency weakens rapidly, briefly touching a key level of 1,400 per dollar for the first time since late 2022.】

item.title: 道明高文说，在美上市的中国企业面临更高的退市风险
item.description: 据道明高文（TD Cowen）称，美国国会可能会迫使该国证券交易所将一些中国公司除名，这种 "真实的风险正在上升"。【原文：There’s a “real and rising risk” that the US Congress may force the country’s stock exchanges to delist some Chinese companies, according to TD Cowen.】

item.title: 韩元下跌吸引躲过芯片大跌的基金押注韩国汽车业
item.description: 一家对冲基金成功躲过了本周韩国芯片股的大跌，该基金正将目光转向汽车制造商，押注韩元走软将为其提供支撑。【原文：A hedge fund that successfully dodged this week’s rout in South Korean chip stocks is turning its focus to automakers on bets that a weaker won will offer support.】

item.title: 人工智能和日元是本财报季亚洲值得关注的热点之一
item.description: 在这个财报季，亚洲的季度盈利增长似乎已准备就绪，交易员们正关注关键主题，以充分利用这一机会。【原文：Asia looks ready to turn a corner in quarterly earnings growth this results season, and traders are focusing on key themes to make the most of the opportunity.】

item.title: 中国研究回落，百万美元分析师职位岌岌可危
item.description: 中国的券商分析师正面临着一个严峻的新现实。【原文：Brokerage analysts in China are confronting a harsh new reality.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好。鲍威尔发出推迟降息的信号。中国试图平息对其新股票交易规则的紧张情绪。美国考虑对伊朗实施更多制裁。市场动态如下。【原文：Good morning. Powell signals a delay to rate cuts. China tries to settle nerves about its new stock exchange rules. And the US considers more sanctions against Iran. Here’s what’s moving markets. — Isabelle Lee】
